book.of.workflow 1.2.3
  • Reference

    Retrieve T-SQL Data

    get_data.Rd

    The workflow for this function is to retrieve the data from SQL Server, post-process it according to the value of argument post.op, and, when tgt.name is not NULL, assign it to an object named according to the value of tgt.name

    get_data(
  this.conn,
  src.name = NULL,
  tgt.name = NULL,
  this.data = NULL,
  post.op = eval,
  chatty = FALSE,
  promise = FALSE,
  persist.conn = TRUE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    this.conn

    A DBI-package connection object

    src.name

    (string) Data source name

    tgt.name

    (string | NULL) When not NULL, the name of the R workspace object to use when assigning the output. Use format obj_name@env_name to specify a target environment to assign the object

    this.data

    (expression) When not NULL, an R object for post-operation only

    post.op

    (object) A function or list of functions to process the retrieved dataset (argument #2) before assigning to workspace

    chatty

    (logical | FALSE) Verbosity flag

    promise

    (logical | FALSE) When TRUE, assignment is done via a call to futureAssign

    persist.conn

    (logical | TRUE) When FALSE, the connection will be closed at the end of execution

    ...

    Arguments to be used by function make_query

    Value

    Invisibly, the retrieved, post-processed dataset

    See also

    Other Data transmission: export_data(), make_query()

    Contents
